title: Is there a way to search a persons face on the Internet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not really. You can, as others have suggested, find or upload a photo of that person, then do an image search of it. (In Chrome, you can right-click any image and select "Search Google for this image.") I have no inside knowledge about how Google image search, but I think it's doing less facial recognition and more matching on generic image features. For example, if you have a photo of a friend wearing a red turtleneck, I'd expect you to get more matches on other people wearing red turtlenecks, and no matches of your friend wearing a business suit. You results may vary, and may change over time. (I just found an online photo of myself, and did a Google image search on it. Most of the matches were of young blonde women. None were wearing non-sun glasses. Stating the obvious: none had a beard. A similar Bing search found no results at all, not even the original photo.) The other alternative is to do a generic search on someone's name, then click the "images" link. This works well for "barack obama." It doesn't work well for "paul s r chisholm." Even with quotes, this search mostly turned up the faces of other people named Paul Chisholm. (It's a surprisingly common name.) Caveat: There are very few photos of me on the World Wide Web. Do any image search results for "John O'Neil" find you? (They do find "John P. O'Neill.") Obligatory disclaimer: I'm not speaking for any search engine.
